|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = <!-- Size of RAM --> |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 03/08/2013 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = G2 Microsystems;G2C547; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "AeroScout", "EX-5000", "200-2104-1000", "AD6232T1 41/11" is silkscreened on the top (and bottom) of the main board in the FCC photos. :"TAG-3500", "20020475000", "AeroScout", and "AD5462T5 44/10" is silkscreened on the G2 WiFi module.
The G2 WiFi module is using a [http://embedded-computing.com/news/g2-family-low-power-wi-fiintegrated-circuits/ ''G2 Microsystems'' G2C547] (G2C547-1) SoC for low power WiFi capability. :There appears to be an additional ''[[Freescale]]'' microcontroller on the board.
The additional RF module is using a ''[[Freescale]]'' M9S / M9S8GT6ACE (M9S8GT6A, CE 4L11Y, CTAX1032) microcontroller and a ''Xilinx'' XC9572XL CPLD.
The microcontroller used in this device appears to be a [http://www.freescale.com/webapp/sps/site/prod_summary.jsp?code=MCF5225X MCF52258 (Coldfire)].
Per the FCC manual, the ''[[AeroScout]]'' EX5100 ''includes the following components''... :Bidirectional Wi-Fi module with only the receiver enabled :Wi-Fi transmitter ([http://www.aeroscout.com/t2 T2 Tag]) which is used by the Exciter for health management :Exciter controller :125 KHz LF Tx
The OUI specified on the FCC label is 00:0C:CC (''[[AeroScout]]''). This is assumed to be correct. :The sample FCC label also has "Stanley Healthcare Solutions" on it. :Likely P/N: 100-2105-1000
Manuf. in Israel?
==Links of Interest== [http://www.aeroscout.com/files/AeroScout%20Exciter%20Data%20Sheet.pdf AeroScout Exciter Datasheet]
[[Category:English Documentation]]
